meanings.definition: To divide or separate into sects or factions based on religious or political beliefs.
meanings.sent1: The community became sectarianized after the disagreement over religious practices.
meanings.sent2: The political leader's divisive rhetoric sectarianized the population.
meanings.sent3: The potluck dinner was almost sectarianized when the debate over the best dessert got heated.
meanings.sent4: The contentious election sectarianized the once-united town.
meanings.sent5: The ancient war story vividly portrayed how easily a society can be sectarianized.

meanings.definition: To cause to become divided along sectarian lines.
meanings.sent1: The new policy change sectarianized the previously harmonious community.
meanings.sent2: The propaganda campaign successfully sectarianized the nation.
meanings.sent3: The friendly game of soccer was humorously sectarianized by the players' playful banter.
meanings.sent4: The unexpected announcement sectarianized the audience, leading to chaos.
meanings.sent5: The powerful speech effectively sectarianized the listeners, stirring up emotions.
